page.title: 01THE MOUNT PLEASANT BLOCK
page.content: The 4km x 3km block covered by{Mount {Pleasant School, Thurso}is mainly grazing and arable land. It does include the school's own catchment area of the town of{Thurso. The part of{Thurso}in the block contains a number of interesting features including{Old St. Peter's {Church,}the river estuary, the harbour, a brickworks, a large furniture shop, a number of small business concerns and a relatively new council housing estate. The farmland is largely flat and open with almost no tree cover except Lady Janet's Wood near{Thurso Castle.} The little high ground that there is in the block provides a view point over the whole area and across the {Pentland Firth}to Orkney. On the southern edge of the block are Caithness flagstone quarries.
